node.title: Air raid sirens sound in Lviv, Ukrainian city that has largely been spared
node.description: Since the beginning of the Russian invasion, Lviv has become a safe harbor for some 200,000 displaced Ukrainians.

node.title: Biden to deliver "major" speech in Poland about Ukraine
node.description: President Biden is meeting with Ukrainian refugees and Poland's president, and delivering what's being billed by the White House as a "major" speech.

node.title: Borrowers waiting as May 1 student loan payment restart approaches
node.description: An analysis by the New York Fed warns student loan borrowers are likely to experience a "meaningful rise in delinquencies" once forbearance ends.

node.title: Russia may be changing its strategy in Ukraine
node.description: A senior U.S. defense official says Russian forces are shifting their ground offensive to the Donbas region in eastern Ukraine.

node.title: Explainer: North Korea's new Hwasong-17 'monster missile'
node.description: North Korea test-fired its massive Hwasong-17 intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM) for the first time this week, here's what it means.

node.title: Taylor Hawkins, Foo Fighters drummer, dead at 50
node.description: Police vehicles, an ambulance and fans were gathered outside the hotel in Bogota where Hawkins was believed to have been staying.

node.title: New rainfall record set this week - NIWA
node.description: A new record for heavy rainfall has been set by this week's torrential downpours.

node.title: Moana Pasifika make history in Super Rugby Pacific
node.description: Moana Pasifika have won their first game of Super Rugby Pacific with a golden point victory over the Hurricanes at Mt Smart Stadium.

node.title: Auckland Zoo’s male rhino dies after sudden illness
node.description: Auckland Zoo's male rhinoceros was euthanised on Wednesday after a sudden untreatable illness.

node.title: Russia signals scaled-back war aim with its forces halted for weeks outside Kyiv
node.description: Moscow has signalled it has scaled back its Ukrainian ambitions to focus on areas claimed by Russian-backed separatists as Ukrainian forces move to recapture towns near Kyiv.

node.title: Tauranga faces double-digit rates hike
node.description: Tauranga's rates could increase 13.7 percent next year, with commissioners insisting it is necessary to pay for infrastructure.

node.title: F1 Saudi GP to go ahead despite nearby attack
node.description: The Saudi Arabian Grand Prix will go ahead as planned after a missile attack on an oil facility near the track in Jeddah.

node.title: Donald Trump sues Hillary Clinton over Russian collusion allegations
node.description: Former US President Donald Trump has sued Hillary Clinton and several other Democrats, accusing them of trying to rig the 2016 US presidential election by linking his campaign to Russia.

node.title: China-Solomons security deal 'very concerning' if true - Mahuta
node.description: The Foreign Minister says New Zealand's High Commissioner will speaking to the Solomons government, "and we will also be raising our concerns directly with China".

node.title: Mediocre fare leaves most sports fans with little to savour
node.description: Comment: These are fairly underwhelming times to be a fan of New Zealand sports teams and athletes, Hamish Bidwell writes.

node.title: St. Peter's becomes the first 15 seed to ever reach the Elite Eight in March Madness upset
node.description: The Peacocks, who won Friday's game 67-64, will now face either UCLA or North Carolina in the East Region final on Sunday.

node.title: Jury awards $14 million to George Floyd protesters in Denver
node.description: "Hopefully, what police departments will take from this is a jury of regular citizens takes these rights very seriously," one lawyer said after the verdict.

node.title: January 6 committee members may subpoena Justice Clarence Thomas' wife
node.description: Several sources told CBS News that some members want Ginni Thomas to meet with the committee and will issue a subpoena if necessary.

node.title: Residents fight back against packs of aggressive canines
node.description: A petition is calling for something to be done about packs of dogs harassing people in Ōtara, but local politicians say the problem runs deeper than just animal management.

node.title: University reviews sexual misconduct complaints after similar case
node.description: The University of Auckland is facing another allegation of sexual misconduct, and is now reviewing its handling of all similar cases.

node.title: NASA pressing ahead with critical moon rocket test
node.description: NASA faces tough schedule with moon rocket test, private astronaut launch and space station crew rotations.

node.title: Weekend gatherings in Christchurch keep police busy in March
node.description: Christchurch police have arrested six people and fined 40 others for breaching liquor laws in suburbs near Canterbury University.

node.title: Police: 'groups' involved in woman's death on Gisborne Street
node.description: Police have launched a homicide investigation after the death of a woman on a Gisborne street.

node.title: Orlando theme park rider appeared to question seat restraint before teen's fatal fall
node.description: "Why doesn't this have a little click to it, like a seatbelt?" the person said.

node.title: US tech giants face tough new rules with new EU deal
node.description: Tech giants may have to change their core business practices in Europe as EU countries and EU lawmakers clinched a deal on landmark rules to curb their powers.

node.title: RNZ-TVNZ public media shake-up: What you need to know
node.description: Explainer - What's the government doing with RNZ and TVNZ - and why? RNZ is here to clear it all up. Audio

node.title: New Orleans public schools lift century-long ban on jazz music and dancing
node.description: The decision comes exactly 100 years to the date it was originally passed in 1922, school officials said.

node.title: Hiker found dead in Montana likely killed by grizzly bear, sheriff says
node.description: Grizzlies have killed at least eight people in the Yellowstone region since 2010.

node.title: Job postings for remote work rise, as many say they like it
node.description: Dropbox is among the tech firms to go "virtual first," with most work taking place outside of company offices.

node.title: Airlines want to drop mask rules. Is now the right time?
node.description: Carriers say it no longer makes sense to have masking and testing requirements in place. Epidemiologists aren't so sure.
